title: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area: Restricted Activities
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Laws & Policies     Restricted Activities                Restricted Activities       Activities and Equipment Not Permitted in the Park  Animal trapping Collecting of artifacts, flowers, or rocks Picking or gathering of mushrooms Use of metal detectors Snowmobile operation Personal water craft (PWCs) or jet skis Off-road vehicles (ORVs), all-terrain vehicles (ATVs), or the use of motorized vehicles on any gated road in the park Sledding and snowboarding are not permitted on the grounds of Cliff Park Inn & Golf Course Glass containers for food and drinks are not permitted at waterfalls where swimming is permitted    Artifacts  Native American, colonial, and other artifacts are protected by federal law Collecting artifacts is prohibited The use of metal detectors is prohibited    Flowers, Rocks, and Fossils  Federal law prohibits the removal of flowers, mushrooms, fossils, and rocks from the park Fruits, nuts, and berries may be gathered for one's personal consumption    Activities Permitted in the Park Subject to Restrictions Certain types of activities require a special use permit. These include many types of organized gatherings, distribution of printed material and other public expressions of opinion, and other activities that are controlled or prohibited.
